messages.content: On Thursday 7 May you face a choice between Labour's plan for a better future and the Tories' plan for the wealthy few. Labour will:

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Save our NHS by investing in the extra staff it so badly needs, with 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 extra GPs
Cut tax for 24 million working people through a lower starting rate of tax and re-instate the 50p tax rate for those earning over £150,000
Scrap the Bedroom Tax and build 200,000 homes a year by 2020 and deliver a fairer deal for private renters with longer tenancies and more predictable rents
Increase the minimum wage to £8 an hour by 2020 and encourage businesses to pay the Living Wage by offering tax rebates if they sign up in the first year
Freeze energy bills until 2017 saving the average household £120 while reforming the broken market so that it works for consumers

leaflet.personalStatement: I was elected to serve Erith & Thamesmead in 2010, and it has been a genuine privilege to be able to represent the area that I have lived for over 30 years. I am passionate about what the Labour Party stands for – fairness, equality and concern for our neighbours. I have worked hard to fulfil my commitment, rebuild trust in politics and to work to address the inequality and injustice that exists in our communities.

politicalExperience.achievements: I care about the things you care about because I live here. I use the same trains, hospitals, roads, shops and services that you do. I have worked hard to be the strong local voice I promised to be, to stick up for our patch and bring change where I can.

images.caption: Teresa Pearce - a strong local voice for Erith and Thamesmead

leaflet.additionalNotes: I am keen to hear what you have to say about our area, our city, and our country, and you will find a survey overleaf that you can complete and return to me.
